hero.headline: AI-Powered Expert Witness Deposition Preparation
hero.subheadline: Preparing for an expert witness deposition requires mastering every detail of prior testimony, published opinions, and case-specific reports. Dodonai helps attorneys summarize transcripts, build chronologies from expert reports, search for contradictions across documents, and organize exhibits — turning days of preparation into hours.

sections.heading: How Attorneys Use AI to Prepare for Expert Witness Depositions
paragraphs: Expert witness depositions are among the highest-stakes events in litigation. The outcome often hinges on whether the deposing attorney has done enough preparation to challenge the expert's methodology, expose inconsistencies in prior testimony, and lock down opinions that can be used at trial. That preparation is document-intensive, requiring attorneys to review prior deposition transcripts, expert reports, published articles, and case records — often running to thousands of pages.

AI document processing tools like Dodonai compress this preparation timeline dramatically. Upload an expert's prior deposition transcripts and receive {{link:/deposition-summary-software/|detailed summaries}} with page-line citations in minutes. Upload expert reports and medical records to build chronologies that map the expert's opinions against the factual record. Use {{link:/ai-deposition-transcript-software/|semantic search across transcripts}} to find every instance where the expert discussed a specific methodology, opinion, or conclusion — including passages that keyword search would miss.

The result is a more thorough, more efficient preparation process. Attorneys arrive at the deposition with organized summaries, identified contradictions, and a clear understanding of the expert's prior positions, all without spending days manually reading and cross-referencing documents.

cards.title: Summarize Prior Expert Testimony
cards.description: Upload an expert's prior deposition transcripts and get page-line or narrative summaries in minutes. Identify the expert's key opinions, methodology descriptions, and admissions without reading every page of prior testimony manually.

cards.title: Find Contradictions Across Transcripts
cards.description: Use semantic search to find every instance where the expert discussed a specific topic across multiple depositions. Compare statements side by side to identify contradictions, shifts in opinion, or inconsistencies between cases that can be used during cross-examination.

cards.title: Build Chronologies from Expert Reports
cards.description: Upload expert reports, medical records, and case documents to generate a unified chronology. Map the expert's stated opinions against the factual timeline to identify gaps, unsupported conclusions, or mischaracterized events.

cards.title: Organize Exhibits for Deposition
cards.description: Use Dodonai's {{link:/electronic-discovery-software/|document management tools}} to organize and tag exhibits for the deposition. Search across your entire document set to find the specific page or passage you need to confront the expert with during testimony.

cards.title: Rapid Reprocessing for New Materials
cards.description: When opposing counsel produces supplemental expert reports or late-disclosed materials, reprocess your preparation documents in minutes. Add new transcripts or reports and generate updated summaries without starting from scratch.

items.title: Upload Expert Transcripts, Reports, and Case Documents
items.description: Upload the expert's prior deposition transcripts, expert reports, published articles, medical records, and any other relevant documents to Dodonai's secure platform. The system accepts PDFs, Word files, and text files, including scanned documents processed with built-in AI OCR.

items.title: AI Summarizes, Searches, and Organizes
items.description: Dodonai generates summaries of each transcript with page-line citations, builds chronologies from reports and records, and indexes everything for semantic search. Specify key topics — such as the expert's methodology, specific opinions, or prior case involvement — to tailor the AI's focus to your deposition strategy.

items.title: Review and Prepare Your Examination Outline
items.description: Use the interactive viewer to review summaries with side-by-side source linking. Search across all documents by concept to find supporting or contradicting passages. Export organized summaries, chronologies, and tagged exhibits as PDF, Word, or Excel files for your deposition binder.

faq.question: How does Dodonai help attorneys prepare for expert depositions?
faq.answer: Dodonai processes the expert's prior deposition transcripts into page-line summaries, builds chronologies from expert reports and medical records, and enables semantic search across all uploaded documents. This gives attorneys a comprehensive, organized view of the expert's prior testimony, opinions, and methodology without spending days on manual document review.

faq.question: Can I search for contradictions across multiple expert depositions?
faq.answer: Yes. Upload multiple transcripts from the same expert and use Dodonai's semantic search to find every instance where the expert discussed a specific topic. The AI searches by meaning, not just keywords, so it catches relevant passages even when the expert used different phrasing across depositions. You can compare statements side by side in the interactive viewer to identify inconsistencies.

faq.question: How quickly can I get summaries of expert deposition transcripts?
faq.answer: Dodonai processes a typical 100-page deposition transcript in approximately 3 minutes. You receive a complete {{link:/deposition-summary-software/|page-line or narrative summary}} with citations, ready for review. If you need to reprocess with different key topics or focus areas, that takes the same amount of time.

faq.question: Can Dodonai handle expert reports and medical records alongside transcripts?
faq.answer: Yes. You can upload expert reports, medical records, published articles, and deposition transcripts together. Dodonai processes each document type appropriately — generating summaries for transcripts, chronologies for medical records, and making everything searchable through the same semantic search interface.

faq.question: Is my case data secure when preparing for expert depositions?
faq.answer: Dodonai is SOC 2 Type II certified and HIPAA compliant. All documents are encrypted with AES-256 in transit and at rest. Your data is never used to train AI models, and you retain full control over data retention and deletion. This applies to all document types including transcripts, expert reports, and medical records.

faq.question: What output formats are available for deposition preparation materials?
faq.answer: Dodonai exports summaries, chronologies, and search results as PDF, Word, Excel, or plain text files. You can download individual summaries or compile materials for a deposition binder. Every output includes source-page citations for quick verification against the original documents.
